page.title: 06POLITICS IN IRELAND
page.content: When N.I. had it's own parliament which enacted laws for this province, it met at Stormount. The parliament buildings were officially opened in 1932 after 4 years construction.It occupies an area of 300 acres.Much of it is parkland and is open to the public.The road leading up to the buildings is a mile long and is a spectacular sight with trees on either side and the Craigantlet Hills in the background. The imposing building where the politicians meet is built in Greek classical style and the interior walls are faced with Italian marble.
